1: Awww a cute little Kougra from Mystery Island.
Aishas dance on a Mystery Island beach!
The coco people love visitors... fried :)
Jhuidah the island faerie runs the Island Cooking Pot.
Aww its a cute little Kougra!
Looks like the island mystics hut...
A Tigerfruity thing, a thingummy, and a whatsitsname.
Triangular stamps were banned in the years 2 and 3 due to a variety of reasons.
The stamp actually tastes of Zeenana when you lick it. Clever, eh?
Arrin the Grarrl was always mocked at school for his tastes in clothing.
I met a hula mistress, somewhere in Waikiki...
Soft Blumaroo, life timeliness sees durable yesterday, gentle.
Apparently they all do something weird if you press a concealed button up their left nostril.
Yes, its no wonder this sand stamp only costs one Neopoint!
You couldnt go and fetch me a bagguss and some asparagus could you?
And you have won.... a can of beans :(
The Island Musician always has something interesting to say.
Ryshu, the powerful Nimmo warrior from Mystery Island
You won't find many of these at the collector fair!
I think this was a practical joke played by one of the employees at the stamp factory.
I think the printer heads must have been misaligned!
Oh dear it looks like someone has tried to take a bite out of this stamp...
2: Stick me on a postcard and ill be your friend
Round and round it goes, where it explodes nobody knows!
When it moves, hit it - HARD!
When you are ruler of the universe you will get to have your own stamp too!
When you manage to deflect an evil death ray from Neopia, you will get your own stamp too!
It's always important to have good teeth when you are taking over the galaxy.
Grundos arrived in Neopia by working for Sloth on the Virtupets Space Station.
A real gargapple is flattened and dried in order to make this stamp.
Behold the legendary Ummagine collector himself!
Ahoy there its Tazzalor the Grundo!
For some reason they didn't print that many Zyrolon stamps so this is very hard to get hold of.
This sparkly stamp features that amazing pilot Ace Zafara!
Arghhh... This Fuzzle even LOOKS evil!!!
Chef extraordinaire, Gargarox runs the world renowned cafe on the space station.
Has anyone ever wondered why Mutant Grundos only come in green?
Wheee... what could be more fun than a Zurroball stamp?
Doh, the printing seems to have messed up on this card...
Wow, the space faerie is inverted on this card, must be rare or something.
The warehouse keeps track of everything that comes in and out of the space station.
This stamp has a top down view of the whole space station - fancy that!
Ooh if you tilt it the logo changes colours!
3: A yellow Chomby against a rather pretty pastel background.
Triangular stamps were banned in the years 2 and 3 due to a variety of reasons.
Grarrg the Grarrl helped out in the first Tyrannian War.
A Tyrannian Kougra in a battle pose - you better run if you dont want to be cut to shreds!
Ahhh, the lovely land of Tyrannia!
The source of food for the whole of Tyrannia - the giant omelette!
Maybe this Grarrl should have looked where he was going.
Mmm... this stamp makes you want to rush to Tyrannia right now!
This stamp features a rather attractive Tyrannian Kyrii.
Aww this little JubJub doesn't look too happy to be on a stamp.
This stamp depicts a Tyrannian Korbat soaring through the skies.
A beautiful scene of the Tyrannian Plateau in daylight.
Three Tyrannian Korbats are performing various aerial tricks in this picture.
Ooh this chair looks just grand in this picture!
A delicate picture of a pair of Giant Leaf Curtains.
A fragile yet beautiful piece of furniture is the focus of this great stamp.
This stamp depicts a beautiful Tyrannian Usul in her natural habitat.
Kyruggi was very good at binary / ascii manipulation!
Fire was such an important discovery!
This stamp is extra special, its shiny!
Wow... this is the rarest stamp in the collection!
4: Do you know when and where Alstaf Poogle died?
Always hungry, the Esophagor is one of the providers of quests in Neopia.
That poor Blumaroo doesn't have much of a life does he?
What was that noise under your bed? It must have been the wind... right?
Uh oh, I wouldnt like to climb THAT tree!
*CACKLE* I shall turn your Neopets to pate and eat them with some low calorie crackers!
Cute, in a kind of mutated way...
Just hope it doesn't end up at the dead-letter office.
Watch out, they are full of custard!
Korbats Lab, the game where you have to destroy the boxes in Sloths Lab, is quite fun!
...d Lupe who guards a particularly deep a...
...nd nasty dungeon in the Haunted Woods.
If you look closely at the moon you can see a Korbat flying across the sky.
Eep! This is one scary character.
This spooky little Zafara spends most of her time brewing bizarre foods and spells.
AIEEEEEE!!!!!! ITS TOO HIDEOUS FOR WORDS!!!
This rare stamp features the evil Count von Roo himself!
Oops, I am sure they meant Neopoints instead of... whatever that is!
Looks more embossed than foil, but oh well...
5: The Alien Aishas really have no clue when it comes to cookery.
Good morning Sir, would you care to open an account?
You haven't experienced pain until a Robot Skeith steps on your foot.
Seller of the greatest hotdogs in the whole of Neopia!
Be careful what you wish for...
Sometimes ghosts will steal money from you and place it on the Money Tree.
When your Neopet comes out, he or she could be any colour in the rainbow!
Neopias resident magic potion maker Kauvara can brew something to change your colour and your species!
Want a good deal? He is the guy to talk to!
The blu.. blue... chia pla.. plays with the b.. a... ll
You worked out the lenny conundrum so you deserve this rare stamp!
This special commemorative stamp was only available from the Advent Calendar in year 5.
Mmmm... doesn't this stamp make you want to book a deluxe room now?
This special commemorative stamp was only available from the Advent Calendar in year 4.
This stamp is much better than your basic Money Tree stamp, its hand painted for a start :)
If your pet is feeling less than chipper, take them to the hospital and they will soon be feeling back to normal.
How pretty, this stamp has three jelly pops on it.
Wow... so this is what Jelly world looks like!
Goodness... could this stamp be any more colourful?!!?
OMG! It's Foil! Must be super expensive!
Mmm... this stamp makes it look as if the chocolate factory is really made of chocolate...
Its midnight in Jelly World, and there is not a soul around!
This aerial shot of Neopia Central is just the thing to complete your set.
6: NeoQuest is a very popular game in Neopia, and can be exceedingly frustrating towards the higher levels.
He looks scary, even in two dimensions.
Not only is it rotting, its also on fire!
Hey, they never said we could get a mist paintbrush!
Last thing you want to meet when you are down to one hit point with no healing potions!
Masters of magic, the archmagi of the Two Rings command armies of lesser wizards, but are themselves formidable foes who may summon the elements to do their bidding.
A long-time resident of Neopia City, Boraxis is there to heal your wounds and injuries whenever you need his assistance.
These ardent defenders of Jahbals realm patrol the hills and forests of the Two Rings mountains, defending against any who would intrude there.

A crazy old servant, Pomanna worked in the jungle research facility until it was overrun by monsters. Now, she hides in the deepest level, protecting her home from invasion by Rollays monstrous lizards.
This mischievious pair may help you out on your travels through the NeoQuest realm.
This black market dealer is now immortalised in stamp form!
Eeek its a terrifying black Bearog
A fierce and noble guardian that will look great in your stamp album.
This Quiggle loves his swamp and has a rather bizarre hobby.
An ancient wizard, trapped within the desert-entombed Temple of Roo is now trapped in a stamp!
This stamp is all shiny and golden!
Once a great ruler of Kal Panning, Faleinn will need your help if she is ever going to break her curse.
For something so small Kreai causes a whole lot of trouble!
Moraxs armour has aided many an eager traveller.
Why choose between light and dark when you can wield them both?
Keen student and sworn enemy of Gors the Mighty, Tylix can prove very helpful in your quest.
You wouldn't get very far without the aid of Eleus!
A gigantic mutated pygmy that you really wouldn't want to meet on a dark night.
Even being banished to the bottom of the Dank Cave didn't stop Xantan proving a real pain to beat.
7: Remember all those great Snow Wars tactics with this catapult stamp.
A colourful design that will look great in any stamp album!
It's a happy little snow man, how cute.
Mmm... this house looks good enough to eat!
A jolly little Bruce brightens up this snowy scene.
This seasonal stamp will brighten up any album.
A beautiful scene taken from the top of Terror Mountain.
Aww look its Mika and Carassa!
Hehe this is the Bruce from the Rink Runner game :)
Behold the grace and elegance of the Christmas Kougra.
This happy little Uni will add some seasonal cheer to any stamp album.
This angelic looking Zafara makes this stamp look simply stunning.
A cute photo of the Wocky that runs the Scratchcard Kiosk :)
Now you can own a Candychan stamp, even if you don't have one as a Petpet.
It almost makes you want to run outside and pick up a snowball.
It looks like someone has hung their stocking up wishing it will magically be filled with presents.
Don't get the letters wrong or the Tuskaninny will plummet to his doom!
This little Kougra looks very happy that it is snowing.
All kinds of frozen treats can be purchased at this shop!
A pretty watercolour of the Negg Faerie and her favourite Negg.
Nobody talks about what went on one dark, cold winter ago...
Eeek the Snowager looks awfully angry in this picture!
A cute little Snowbunny has hopped right into this stamp!
The rarest stamp in the Snowy Valley collection!
8: The heroes of the story, the ones that discovered the lost realm of Meridell.
How does it stay in the air?
What a lovely castle, shame it is about to be reduced to rubble.
The Green Knight fighting a Draconian Skeith
Loyal, gruff and incredibly large, it's no wonder nobody disagrees with him.
One of many loyal Moehog warriors that fought for the freedom of Darigan.
Without the loyal Draik guards Meridell Castle would be defenceless.
The only prisoner to escape the dungeons of Darigan beams smugly from this stamp.
A symbol of honour and pride to all of Meridell.
Possibly the cutest thing to come out of Darigan.
This shield seems to have some bad anti-aliasing around it. I wonder if that was on purpose?
Swooping down from the sky this Eyrie terrified many a Meridell resident before the war was over.
Ooops looks like someone got a little hungry while making this stamp!
Dark, brooding and mysterious, this Elemental is something you don't want to mess with.
The stamps border contrasts perfectly with Illusen's chestnut hair, almost as if she planned it.
The loyal Jeran, defender of all things true and fair.
A glistening enchanting gem that holds many mysterious powers.
Its our lovable heroes in zombie form!
Once a proud ruler of a fair kingdom, Lord Darigan searched for the orb to restore peace to his citadel.
King Skarl, ruler of Meridell and possibly the grumpiest king in Neopia.
Master Vex is a prison warden who is incredibly bored. Lord Darigan has entrusted him to keep his dungeons safe and secure.
The twisted demonic version of Lord Darigan brings tears to most Neopets eyes.
9: This glossy stamp has a cute Khamette on a holographic background.
A collection of four Petpets in a cute Lost Desert setting.
This sun has just risen over the giant pyramid in the Lost Desert.
A friendly Grarrl is waving to you in this picture.
Oooh it's that sneaky Advisor Wessle from the Usurper game.
Palpus is an old retired general in the Sakhmet Defence Force.
A beautiful night scene featuring a majestic Desert Lupe.
This stamp is decorated with a design from one of Osiris world famous pieces of art.
Senator Barca requested a sepia tone stamp to show off her complexion.
This dazzling paint brush design is much sought after.
This kind Peophin runs the Lost Desert Petpet shop where she cares for Petpets until they can find good homes.
A bit of a delicacy in the Lost Desert, Grackle Bugs are best cooked over an open fire.
This stamp features the beautiful yet treacherous Princess Sankara.
This stamp looks a little bit tatty around the edges. It must be very old!
Nobody knows how it got there or who made it but it is very impressive.
Everyone loves the Fruit Machine, especially this happy little Kougra.
Princess Vyssa gave special permission to allow this stamp to be printed.
A lovely sunset secene captured forever on this delightful stamp.
This cute Geb stamp is actually pretty rare.
Sorry Donna I borrowed this for a Lenny Conundrum prize!
A real piece of art, this scarab is made from very delicate hand made paper.
Ooh this stamp features the legendary Lucky Coin that Brucey B used to win all those Cheat games...
A mystical place where some say they can still feel King Coltzans presence.
10: Ok so it can't help you in the Battledome, but it will look pretty snazzy in your stamp collection.
Many people laugh at the Attack Pea and many people get hit by it!
Mmm Slorg Flakes, everyone loves them right?
How can something so pretty hurt so much?
What a harmless looking thing, but press the wrong switch and this box turns into a lethal weaopon...
Eraser of the Dark Faerie Stamp
Wow what a long name for such a little thing...
Argh get it away from me, its cursed you know!
Ooh this stamp is very shiny! Even the crystal ball has sparkly bits inside it!
Sword of the Air Faerie Stamp
An elegant edition to any stamp album!
A dazzling, sparkly stamp that really makes this weapon look stunning.
Aiii.... this rod is scary looking...
Ok so the real thing may be retired, but at least you can own the stamp.
You may not be able to get your hands on the real thing, but at least you can own the stamp.
Whee.. Exploding Space Bugs are always fun...
It even looks menacing on a stamp!
Wand Of The Dark Faerie Stamp
Betcha wish you had the real thing.
Ahh the legendary Alien Aisha Myriad...
Interesting design. I wonder what happens if I press thi... BLAM!
The legendary Kings Lens, so named after King Coltzan himself.
A dastardly weapon if ever there was one. This was given out by the advent calendar in year 5.
Far more than just a gnarled piece of wood.
This stamp will remind you to practice those anagrams so one day you may own the real thing!
It's your colourful flexible friend (unless it takes something from you that is).
Don't lick it too hard, your tongue may fall off.
11: Worth at least five bronze Babaas.
Is it a coin? Is it a book? Its a coin!
Uuuuuuusuki! This coin is a must for any Usuki collector.
Visit the money tree often and you may just find one of these!
Each time you look at this coin you will remember one of Elivs horrid conundrums.
Aww how sweet it's a little Turtum.
A rather snazzy looking coin that will go amazingly well in your collection.
Brr, just looking at this coin makes me chilly!
One of Tyrannias most famous landmarks is now available in coin form!
Aww its a cute little Hasee, how sweet!
A jolly momento for anyone who has been to Mystery Island.
What an unusual shape, it is pretty though!
Just looking at this coin sends shivers down your spine!
A special coin dedicated to those brave Defenders Of Neopia.
If you love Goo Blasters, you will adore this shiny coin!
This coin may be small but it is very rare...
A gleaming souvenier of your trip to the Rainbow Pool.
Mmm this golden coin is dipped in chocolate!
This solid silver coin has a Scorchstone engraved in it!
A silver coin to commemorate Neopias number one villain.
Take this to Kauvara, she may trade it for one of her potions... then again she may not.
This hard to get hold of coin was minted to commemorate Neopian Times Day.
Quite possibly the rarest coin in all Neopia!
12: Eww someone has dropped this graspberry in the mud!
Meridell, home of royalty, fine castles and slimy kissing things...
Jerans legendary sword sparkles magnificently on this shiny stamp.
How pretty, dont you just want to go there.
One of Kaylas more successful potions...
Will she ever find her prince?
Aww how cute, this stamp has a Gallion on it!
This brave look out watches the skies of Meridell and warns the king of any danger.
Stern protector of Meridell, this spectre has come in handy on many an occasion.
If you need to keep up with the castle gossip, just talk to this little Usul.
Keeping King Skarl happy is anything but easy!
Funny, he even looks grumpy as a plushie!
A brilliant sparkling stamp that will be the pride of your collection.
Old castles are simply full of secret passages you know!
A handful of these will have your opponents running for cover.
The question is not whose side is she on, but rather whose side is she on today?
The trusty Battle Unis are always ready to defend Meridell, no matter what the cost.
What a pretty little thing, how can she be bad?
This devious little Mycni has been responsible for many a great battle!
This withered old Moehog has many tricks up her sleeves.
It looks as if a heroic conflict has taken place on this once grassy meadow...
Saviour of the Darigan Citadel or savage war lord... you decide!
This is the rarest and most expensive stamp in the whole set!
13: Ahh the peaceful town of Trestin, doesnt it look pretty.
If you are looking for answers who better to ask than a librarian?
This kindly old Blumaroo is the third stamp in the NeoQuest II set.
Eep it looks a little deserted, maybe you shouldnt go there.
Well you didnt think Hubrid would live in a pretty pink castle did you?!
A shining stamp that will look great in your NeoQuest II album!
Grrr its a scary Devilpuss that you would have fought many times in NeoQuest II.
Oooh this is a very cool item in NeoQuest II you know!
How cool the edge of the stamp is all shiny so it looks like slime!
Eep, this is one Spyder you dont want to meet on a dark night!
Its so cute yet scary at the same time!
From this mighty tower you can see for miles around.
Congratulations, you seem to have found the lost city!
What an awfully spooky place, I wouldnt want to live there...
Well you didnt really think he lived in a cave did you?
Possibly the most famous Techo to date!
Swift of foot and deadly with a bow, Talinia makes a great ally.
Here Rohane is showing off his extra special armour, you did unlock that right?
Possibly the most fashionably dressed heroine NeoQuest II has ever seen!
A shining sword that will banish evil wherever it goes.
This special edition Esophagor Stamp is from the NeoQuest II set.
Argh its Scuzzy! Run for your lives!
One of the rarest stamps in the set, the Anubits stamp has silver foil edging.
A mighty Bruce that you will cross paths with many times in NeoQuest II.
This mighty beast is the ultimate bad guy and the perfect stamp to complete your collection.

43: I wonder what her wand does...?

Bask in the warmth of the sunlight and breathe that fresh forest air!
Well-equipped to fight the forces of evil!
This book looks like it possesses a great power...
A fierce wyvern! You don't want to end up on its bad side.
Spite, Malice, and Vanity... clearly up to no good.
A beautiful portrait of the Faerie Queen.

Jeran, in the midst of chaos!
An eerie scene - a castle in disrepair.

44: Oh no! You scratched the wrong things…
The latest and greatest in Braku Berry farming, this variety has super-sized berries that are both delicious and fun to throw at your friends!
Benji, I’m going to let you in on a little secret. Every day, once a day, give yourself a present. Don’t plan it, don’t wait for it, just let it happen.
Go to NeoSchool or University. Get a Faerie Job, that’s what they said to me. But I could never live the way they want!
Well hi!!! Aren’t you going to say hi back?
Some say it was just a balloon, but Space Wizard knows what it was really about.
Once licked by the mighty scary pet, SUNSHINE MONK!
No map piece this time, but a stamp is a decent consolation prize!

45: Kougra Iron is a very powerful stone. Use it wisely!
What a mesmerizing swirl of blues and oranges...
Not to be confused with the ingredient for bread.
When polished, this aggregate rock looks like it is adorned with posies!
A gem that looks just like fossilized tree sap!
Kyanite is anisotropic - that means its hardness varies depending on the direction of applied stress!
Some say that moonstones were hand delivered to Neopia by the Space Faerie herself!
Black and white bands span this beautiful chalcedony.
Although topaz is colorless in its natural state, this specimen's impurities give it an incredible orange hue.
This gem's strirations can look like a menacing feline eye!
A pale blue beryl that invokes memories of the ocean.
A pristine quartz crystal with a deep violet hue.
A fusion of pearl and amethyst! Wait... -checks notes- ...that might not be right. But still very pretty.
Trace impurities in this obsidian refract light with cosmological brilliance!
This gorgeous variety of opal has a black tint due to trace amounts of iron oxide.
The most stunning blue you can find in the world of gems.
The crème de la crème of the gem world. Look at that sparkle!
46: Volcanic glass. Be careful - it can be incredibly sharp!

Named for the professor who discovered it - Dr. Grundy Grundo Grundensen!
A bubblegum pink shade of quartz.

A geode with a deeply comforting purple hue.
Wow, lucky find! This might need some refining.
Wow, this must have been some kind of fern!
Often sold by the sea shore.

47: Ever wonder what was in Fantastic Fly Pie?

This scarab is covered in a fancy fringe!
With wings that glisten like... a sapphire!

This beautiful green scarab has a fascinating pattern on its back that is quite hypnotising.

The spots on this Scarabs back scare away its enemies!
This beetle is almost as old as Tyrannia!
